Body:
In generative grammar, it has long been argued that German is indeed SOV, that the verb-final order is revealed in subordinate clauses, and that the Verb Second (V2) order in main clauses is due to a complex transformation. The locus classicus for the argument is:

Bach, Emmon, (1962) The order of elements in a transformational grammar of German. Language 38, 263-269. JSTOR

The online syntax textbook by Beatrice Santorini and Tony Kroch has further information about this idea:

http://www.ling.upenn.edu/~beatrice/syntax-textbook/ch5.html#mixed http://www.ling.upenn.edu/~beatrice/syntax-textbook/ch14.html

OwnerUser.AboutMe: I'm a professor of linguistics at MIT. I work on meaning. I am also Associate Dean of MIT's School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences. I have a wife, two kids, two cats, and a dog. I live in an intentional community (Mosaic Commons Cohousing) in Berlin, Massachusetts. I am a runner. I like soccer, a lot. I was born on a cold winter’s night in a small village on the Lüneburg Heath in Northern Germany.
